SEARCH
Package org.trikkle

Class Node

java.lang.Object
org.trikkle.Node
All Implemented Interfaces:
Congruent<Node>, Primable
Direct Known Subclasses:
DiscreteNode, EmptyNode, StreamNode
public abstract class Node extends Object implements Primable, Congruent<Node>
A vertex in the execution graph representing datums to be filled.
Since:
0.1.0

  • Method Details

    • addDatum

      public final void addDatum(String datumName, Object datum)
      Adds a datum to the overseer cache of this node. The datum must have been declared by this node.
      Parameters:
      datumName - the name of the datum
      datum - the datum
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the node is not primed with an overseer
      IllegalArgumentException - if the datum was not declared by the node

    • uncheckedAddDatum

      protected abstract void uncheckedAddDatum(String datumName, Object datum)

    • isUsable

      public boolean isUsable()

    • setUsable

      public void setUsable()
      Irreversibly sets the node to usable.

    • getProgress

      public double getProgress()

    • setProgress

      public final boolean setProgress(double progress)
      Sets the progress of the node. Must be between 0 and 1. If the progress is less than the current progress, the progress will not be updated.

      If the progress is set to 1, the node will be set to usable.

      Parameters:
      progress - the progress of the node
      Returns:
      true if the progress was updated
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the progress is not between 0 and 1
      See Also:
      • setUsable()

    • congruentTo

      public boolean congruentTo(Node node)
      Two nodes are equal if they are the same object. They are congruent if they have the same datum names.
      Specified by:
      congruentTo in interface Congruent<Node>
      Parameters:
      node - the node to compare to
      Returns:
      true if the nodes are congruent

    • primeWith

      public void primeWith(Overseer overseer)
      Specified by:
      primeWith in interface Primable

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the node to its initial state. The node will be set to not usable and have progress of 0. The overseer will be set to null.
      Specified by:
      reset in interface Primable

    • getLock

      public ReentrantLock getLock()
      Specified by:
      getLock in interface Primable

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
